page.title: 15Housing Around Braydon 1
page.content: The distribution of housing in this section is related to the topography. The low lying land, Braydon, which makes up most of the section consists of mainly farms and scattered cottages with one school and one chapel which have been converted into private houses and a large country house which has been converted into 33 luxury flats and let to tenants. The majority of the housing is on the high ground on the eastern edge of the section with a small hamlet on a rise to the south. The hamlet Greenhill has 31 houses strung along one road which goes nowhere else. The other area - Pavenhill and Purton - consists of a development of individually designed houses and bungalows built about 20 years ago and several much older houses.
